page.title: How it works
page.goal: Explain the workflow clearly and reduce anxiety: preview-first, approval step, credits, and what changes per tier.

sections.headline: A simple loop: intake → preview → approve → ship
sections.subheadline: You stay in control. Nothing goes live until you approve.
sections.notes: Keep this page extremely clear. Avoid hype.

sections.headline: The workflow
bullets: 1) Intake: tell us what you do and who you serve
2) Plan: we generate a structured improvement plan
3) Preview: you see before/after style examples or a staged preview (tier-dependent)
5) Approve: you approve when it's right
6) Deploy: publish changes (mechanism depends on setup)
sections.notes: Use a numbered stepper. Each step should have 1–2 short lines.

sections.headline: What changes by tier
sections.notes: Show 3 columns with outcome-focused descriptions. Include: credits included, deliverable type, and what the loop emphasizes (polish/conversion/transformation).

sections.headline: Revisions are credit-based (so it's not unlimited)
bullets: Buy more credits if you want additional loops
sections.notes: Keep consistent with Pricing page wording.

sections.headline: Premium: Builder is UI execution only
bullets: Allowed surfaces: homepage UI, landing UI, pricing UI
sections.notes: This is a guardrail section. Keep it strict and explicit.

sections.headline: What we need from you
bullets: Connections for add-ons (only if you choose them)

sections.headline: Ready to see your plan and preview?
sections.notes: Mobile CTA visible by ~20% scroll when sticky enabled.

mobileRequirements: Stepper must be readable and not cramped on mobile
No dual-primary CTAs in the same section
No dense paragraphs (>3 lines) on mobile

mustPass: Premium Builder scope restrictions stated plainly
shouldPass: Tier differences are outcome-based, not feature soup
